attributes.action: increase the allowance for ISA in the coming budgets
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Bank of England has been steadily cutting the base rate and it now sits at the lowest level since the Bank’s inception.
For those in the UK who have been prudent with their finances over the past years, the critical drop in interest rates causes problems in the reduced income for their savings.
It is reported that more than 7 million people have saving accounts that already pay interest of 1% or less. Just over six months ago, savers were enjoying rates approaching 7%. This is a source of funding that is available for the UK Banking sector, but may soon be ‘lost’ to non-UK Banks who are offering 5%.
ISA is a mechanism by which funds are made available on a longer term investment but they are currently capped at too low threshold.
To allow funds to be re-invested through the UK Banking system, the threshold for the ISA should be increased
